meanings.definition: A prehistoric stone or metal tool with a beveled cutting edge.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist found a celt while excavating the ancient site.
meanings.sent2: The celt was used by early humans for cutting and shaping materials.
meanings.sent3: The celt thought it was sharp until it met a diamond blade.
meanings.sent4: Her wit was as sharp as a celt, cutting through any argument effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The celt gleamed in the sunlight, a testament to ancient craftsmanship.

meanings.definition: A member of a group of ancient Celtic-speaking peoples in Europe.
meanings.sent1: The celt was proud of their heritage and traditions.
meanings.sent2: Many celts settled in the lush green valleys of Europe.
meanings.sent3: The celt told a joke that made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: She stood out in the crowd like a celt among rocks.
meanings.sent5: The celtic culture was rich in myths and legends, passed down through generations.

meanings.definition: A style of music originating in Ireland and Scotland.
meanings.sent1: The celt played a traditional tune on their fiddle.
meanings.sent2: The lively celt music filled the pub with joyous melodies.
meanings.sent3: The celt danced to the music with graceful movements.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like a celtic melody, soothing and enchanting.
meanings.sent5: The celtic music transported listeners to a magical world of folklore and fantasy.
